question_title: What will the United States score on the 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index?
summary: The US scored 65 on the 2024 CPI (record low since 2012 methodology). The 2025 CPI, releasing Feb 10, 2026, will capture major 2025 developments including FCPA enforcement pause, ethics requirement rescissions, and documented conflicts of interest. Historical max single-year decline is 4 points. I forecast median ~61 (4-point decline matching historical max), with uncertainty allowing 57-65. The Manifold market showing 74% probability of 2026 being lower than 2025 supports continued decline expectations. Distribution is asymmetric, weighted toward larger declines given unprecedented policy environment.

factors.description: Clear downward trend from 76 (2015) to 65 (2024) - consistent decline over 9 years
Major anti-corruption policy reversals in 2025: FCPA pause, ethics requirements rescinded, anti-corruption units disbanded
2024's 4-point drop occurred BEFORE Trump's 2nd term policies took effect - 2025 CPI will capture these developments
Manifold market shows 74% probability 2026 score will be lower than 2025 score
Documented conflicts: billions in payments/gifts to Trump family, crypto ventures, foreign government gifts
Historical constraint: largest single-year drops have been 4 points (2017-2018, 2023-2024)
CPI methodology lag: surveys capture perceptions which may trail actual policy changes
